abstract: The Treasury Department plans to announce Tuesday that it will allow 10 banks, including JPMorgan Chase, to pay back Troubled Asset Relief Program funds.
snippet: The Treasury Department plans to announce Tuesday that it will allow 10 banks, including JPMorgan Chase, to pay back Troubled Asset Relief Program funds.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department plans to announce Tuesday that it will allow 10 banks, including JPMorgan Chase, to pay back Troubled Asset Relief Program funds, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: U.S. to Announce 10 Banks Can Repay Aid, Report Says

abstract: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and eight other large banks were deemed strong enough by federal regulators to return more than $68 billion in taxpayer aid.
snippet: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and eight other large banks were deemed strong enough by federal regulators to return more than $68 billion in taxpayer aid.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration marked with little fanfare a major milestone in its bank rescue effort  its decision on Tuesday to let 10 big banks repay federal aid that had sustained them through the worst of the crisis  as policy makers and industry executives focused on the challenges still before them.

headline.main: 10 Large Banks Allowed to Exit U.S. Aid Program
headline.print_headline: 10 Large Banks Allowed to Exit U.S. Aid Program

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corp

abstract: Shortly after the Treasury Department allowed 10 big banks to repay federal bailout money, the chief of one of those firms, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, sent a memo to employees about the move. Read it on DealBook.
snippet: Shortly after the Treasury Department allowed 10 big banks to repay federal bailout money, the chief of one of those firms, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, sent a memo to employees about the move. Read it on DealBook.
lead_paragraph: Barely a week ago, Jamie Dimon, the head of JPMorgan Chase, joked about writing a “Dear Timmy” letter to the Treasury secretary announcing his bank’s departure from the government bailout.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Dimon on Repaying TARP Money
